The rooms that were on the first floor were 230 centimeters wide. The rooms that were on the second floor were 275 centimeters wide. And the rooms that were on the third floor were 320 centimeters wide. The walls of the high rooms were thinner than the walls of the low rooms. So a flat ledge was at the top of each low wall. The flat ledge held up the poles that held up the floor. So the poles were not in the temple walls. Footnote: In the Hebrew, this distance is twenty cubits.

Solomon was famous because of Yahweh's name.
Spice is seeds that people put in food so-that it would taste good.
Solomon had 700 wives who were princesses and three hundred other women. Solomon's wives caused him to serve other gods.
When Solomon became old, his wives caused him to serve other gods. Although David, who was Solomon's father, completely served Yahweh, Solomon didn't completely serve Yahweh.
People did many the things.
Yahweh has caused you to be king so-that when you rule Israel, you would be just and righteous.”
Person was full of joy.
Yahweh made a promise to my father named David by his mouth and has used his powerful hand in order to cause it to become true.
Shields are pieces metal that soldiers hold in order to protect them.
Ivory is ivory.
Steps are steps.
The money that King Solomon had was more than it.
Solomon kept some chariots and some horses in the chariots cities and kept other chariots and of other them with the king in Jerusalem.
Person's sin is something of him that Yahweh hates.

I'll cause your royal family to have terrible trouble because you have done these things. Primary: I'll cut off from you all of the people who are in Israel. Alternate 1: I'll separate from you all of the people who are in Israel. End of Alternates. Primary: I'll cut off the young people from you. Alternate 1: I'll separate the young people from you Primary: And cut off the old people from you. Alternate 1: And I will separate the old people from you. End of Alternates. I'll burn your royal family like people burn things that they throw away. I'll completely destroy your royal family.
Some people who belong to you'll die in the city. Dogs will eat those people. Other people who belong to you'll die in the country. The birds will eat those people. Yahweh has said these things!”
Return to your house now. When you enter your city, your son will die.

All of Israel's people will cry because your son is dead. Then they'll bury your son. Your son is the only person who belongs to Jeroboam that people will bury. People will bury your son because he is the only good person that I have found who belongs to Jeroboam's royal house. I'm the Lord. I'm God Israel.
I'll choose a king for my people named Israel. That king will destroy Jeroboam's family. Today your son will die. He is dying now.

Yahweh will destroy Israel. Israel will be like tall grass that moves in the water. Yahweh will pull Israel from this good land like people pull grass from the earth. He gave this good land to Israel's people's ancestors. He'll scatter Israel's people. He'll send Israel's people to the east side of the Euphrates river. He'll do these things because Israel's people have caused him to be very angry. Israel's people made poles that they used in order to serve the female god named Asherah.
I'll abandon Israel because of Jeroboam's sins. Jeroboam has also caused Israel to do the same sins.”
Then Jeroboam's wife started going and left Ahijah's house. She went to the city named Tirzah. When Jeroboam's wife stepped through the door of the house, her son died.

Israel's people buried Jeroboam's son and mourned because he was dead. These things were the things that Yahweh had said that will happen. Yahweh had said these things through his servant named Ahijah, who told God's messages to the people.

People wrote about the things that Jeroboam did while he ruled Israel. They wrote about the wars and the kind of ruler that Jeroboam was. They wrote down these things in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
Jeroboam ruled Israel for 22 years. Then he joined his family's people who had already died. After Jeroboam died, his son named Nadab became the next king.

Rehoboam was king in Judah. Rehoboam was Solomon's son. When Rehoboam became king, he was 41 years old. He ruled Judah in Jerusalem for 17 years. Yahweh had chosen Jerusalem from all of the cities of the tribes of Israel. Primary: He wanted to put his name there. Alternate 1: Yahweh wanted to be there. End of Alternates. Rehoboam's mother was Naamah who was from Ammon.

The people of Judah did things that Yahweh said that they shouldn't do because they are evil. The people of Judah's sins caused Yahweh to become angry. Yahweh became angry because the people of Judah refused to worship only him. The people of Judah did things that caused Yahweh to become angry more than all of the people who previously lived.

Judah's people also set religious places up themselves so-that they could serve gods there. They set religious stones up. They set up poles that they used in order to serve the female god named Asherah. They did these things on each high hill and under each green tree.

There even were men who sexed with people for money at the temples that were in the land. The people did all of the things that the other nations did. Yahweh hated those things. He had forced those nations to leave the land so-that the people of Israel could live in the land.
Shishak attacked Jerusalem in the fifth year when Rehoboam was king. He was the king of Egypt.

Shishak took the treasures of Yahweh's temple. He also took the treasures of the royal palace. He took all of those things. The things that Shishak took included all of the gold shields that Solomon had made.
So King Rehoboam made metal shields that replaced the gold shields. He gave the metal shields to the commanders of the soldiers who guarded the entrance of the royal palace.
Whenever the king went to Yahweh's temple, the soldiers carried those shields. Later they returned the shields to the room where they kept them.
People wrote about the other things that happened while Rehoboam was king. They wrote down in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah all of the things that Rehoboam did.
Rehoboam and Jeroboam were always fighting each other.

Rehoboam joined his family's people who had already died. People buried Rehoboam in his family's tomb that was in the city of David. Rehoboam's mother was Naamah who was from Ammon. After Rehoboam died, his son named Abijah became the next king.
The officials said to the king of Israel, “Your servant named Ben-Hadad says, “Please let me live.””
There were people of group named of prophets people.

My master, did you hear about the things that I did? Jezebel was killing Yahweh's prophets. But I hid one hundred of those people in two caves. I put fifty of those people in each cave and gave food and water to them.
And now you're telling me to go to my master named Ahab. You want me to say to Ahab, “Elijah is here.” Ahab will kill me!”
Elijah said, “I serve Yahweh who rules all things. You know that Yahweh lives. Know that I'll speak to Ahab today like you know that Yahweh lives.”
Obadiah returned to Ahab and told him that Elijah wanted to see Ahab. So Ahab went to the place where Elijah was.
When Ahab saw Elijah, he said to Elijah, “Are you Elijah? You're always causing Israel to have trouble.”
Elijah said, “I haven't caused Israel to have trouble. But you and your father have caused Israel to have trouble. You have turned Yahweh's commands. You have followed gods that are named Baal.

Send a message to all of Israel's people now. Tell the people to come to me on Mount Carmel. And bring the 450 prophets of the god named Baal. Also bring the 400 prophets of the female god named Asherah. All of those prophets eat food at Jezebel's table.”
So Ahab sent that message to people in all of Israel. He gathered the prophets on Mount Carmel.

Elijah went there and stood in front of the people. He said, “How long will you think about choosing the god that you'll worship? If Yahweh is the one true God, worship him. But if Baal is the one true God, worship him.” The people didn't say anything.
Then Elijah said to the people, “I'm Yahweh's only prophet who still is alive. But Baal has 450 prophets.

Get two bulls us. Let the prophets of Baal choose one bull for themselves. Let they cut the bull into pieces. Then let they put those pieces on the wood. But let they burn the wood with fire. I'll prepare the other bull. I'll put the other bull on the wood. But I'll start burning the wood with fire.
Then pray to your god. And I will pray to Yahweh. The god that answers the prayer by sending fire is the one true God.” Then all of the people said, “The things that you're saying are good.”
Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Choose one of the bulls. You're many. So prepare your bull first. Pray to your god. But start burning the wood with fire.”

So those prophets prepared the bull that had been given to them by the people. They started praying to Baal in the morning and prayed to him until noon. They shouted, “Answer us!” But nothing happened. No god answered the prayers those prophets. Then those prophets danced around the altar that they had made.

At noon Elijah started mocking those prophets. He said, “Baal is a god. So shout louder! Perhaps Baal is thinking about too many things. Or perhaps he is doing another thing. Or perhaps he isn't here because he is traveling. Perhaps he is sleeping. You might need to wake Baal up.”
So those prophets shouted louder. They cut themselves with swords and spears until their blood flowed. These things were the customs that those prophets did.

In the afternoon the prophets of Baal continued shouting. Those prophets did this thing until the time when the priests gave the gift to God in the evening. But there was no answer. No god answered the prayers of those prophets. No god did something because of the actions of those prophets.
Then Elijah said to all of the people, “Come here. Come to me.” So the people went to Elijah. Elijah repaired Yahweh's altar that people had destroyed.
Elijah took twelve stones. For each tribe of Jacob's family, there was one stone. Jacob received the word of Yahweh. The word of Yahweh said, “Your name will be Israel.”
Elijah built with the stones an altar that honored Yahweh. He dug a trench around the altar. The trench was deep enough so-that ten kilograms of seed could be in it.

Elijah arranged the wood the fire. He cut the bull into pieces and put them on the wood. Then Elijah said to some people, “Fill four big jars with water. Pour the water on the gift and on the wood.” Then those people did those things.
Elijah said, “Pour water on the offering again.” So those people did those things again. Elijah said, “Pour water on the offering third times.” Then those people did those things third times.
The water flowed around the altar. The people even filled the trench with water.

When the time was the time when the priests offered the gift in the evening, the prophet named Elijah went in front of the altar. Elijah prayed to Yahweh, “Yahweh, you're the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel. Today let each person know that you're God in Israel. Let each person know that I'm your servant. Let each person know that I have done all of these things because you commanded me to do them.

Answer me. Yahweh, answer me so-that these people would know that you're the one true God. Primary: These people will know that you're turning their hearts you again. Alternate 1: These people will know that you're bringing them to you again.”
The fire of Yahweh came. The fire burned the sacrifice. The fire burned the wood and the stones and the dirt. The fire even dried the water that was in the trench.
All of the people saw the fire. Then they fell on the ground and put their faces near the ground. They cried, “Yahweh is the one true God! Yahweh is the one true God!”

Then Elijah commanded the people, “Catch the prophets of Baal. Don't let any of the prophets of Baal escape!” So the people caught the prophets of Baal. Elijah caused people to bring the prophets of Baal to the valley named Kishon. And he caused people to kill the prophets of Baal there.
Then Elijah said to Ahab, “Go. Eat and drink. I hear the sound of a lot of rain.”
So Ahab went in order to eat and in order to drink. But Elijah climbed to the top of Mount Carmel. He bent over toward the ground. Then he put his face between his knees.
Then Elijah said to his servant, “Go and look toward the sea.” So Elijah's servant went up and looked. He said, “I don't see anything toward the sea.” Seven times Elijah said, “Go and look again.”

After the seventh times, the servant said, “I see a cloud. The cloud is small like a person's hand is small. And the cloud is rising over the sea.” Elijah said, “Go to Ahab. Say to Ahab, “Tie your chariot to your horse. Before the rain prevents you from going, go to Jezreel.””
Black clouds covered the sky. The wind became strong. And a lot of rain started falling. Ahab rode his chariot and went to Jezreel.
Yahweh caused Elijah to become powerful. Elijah put his coat into his belt and ran to Jezreel in front of Ahab.
Each man of Israel killed the soldier who was fighting him. When the soldiers of the army of Aram saw the men of Israel killing them, they ran away from them.
While I was doing other things here and there, the man escaped.

Ben-Hadad who was the king of Aram brought his whole army to one place. Then he went to Samaria. He took 32 kings that he ruled, and their horses, and their chariots with him. All of those soldiers surrounded Samaria and attacked it.
Ben-Hadad sent messengers into the city. The messengers spoke to Ahab, who was the king of Israel.
The messengers said to Ahab, “Ben-Hadad says, “Your silver and your gold belong to me. Your best wives and your best children also belong to me.””
The king of Israel answered, “The things that you say are true. You're my king and my master. I belong to you. And each thing that I have belongs to you.”
The messengers came to Ahab again. They said to Ahab, “Ben-Hadad says, “I commanded you to give your silver and your gold to me. I also commanded you to give your wives and your children to me.

But tomorrow I'll send my officials to you. About this time my officials will come to you. They'll search for those things in the palace. They'll search for those things in your officials' houses. They'll take all of the things that you care for. And they'll take all of those things away.””

The king of Israel called all of the elders of the land. He said to those elders, “Know that this man is searching for trouble! This man sent messengers to me. This man demanded that I give my wives and my children to him. This man demanded that I give my silver and my gold to him. And I agreed to give those things to this man.”
All of the elders and all of the people answered, “Don't listen to that man. Don't agree to give that man the things that he wants.”

So Ahab answered the messengers Ben-Hadad, “Say to my king and master, “I'll do all of the things that you commanded me in the first message to do. But I'm not able to do the things that you want me in the second message to do.”” The messengers took Ahab's answer to Ben-Hadad.

Then Ben-Hadad sent another message to Ahab. Ben-Hadad said, “If all of the people who follow me try to fill their hands with dust, there won't be enough dust. If there is enough dust, the gods should punish me severely.”
The king of Israel answered, “Say to Ben-Hadad, “A person who put his armor on shouldn't speak like the person who takes off his armor may speak.””

When Ben-Hadad heard the message, he and the kings were drinking wine in their tents. Ben-Hadad ordered his men, “Prepare in order to attack the city.” So Ben-Hadad's men prepared in order to attack the city.

During that time a prophet came to Ahab who was the king of Israel. The person said, “Yahweh says, “Do you see this extremely big army? I'll help you defeat that army today. Then you'll know that I'm Yahweh.””

Ahab asked, “But who will do this thing?” The person answered, “Yahweh says, “The young men who serve the governors will do this thing.”” Ahab asked, “And who will fight the battle?” That person answered, “You'll start fighting the battle.”

So Ahab called those young men who served the governors. The total number of the young men was 232. Ahab gathered the other people of Israel. The total number of the people that Ahab gathered was 7000.
When the time was 12pm, those young men left. That time Ben-Hadad and the 32 kings, who were helping him, were in their tents. Those kings were becoming drunk.

The young men who served the governors of Ahab marched first. Ben-Hadad had sent people toward the city so-that they could watch it. Those people returned to Ben-Hadad and said, “Men are marching from Samaria toward our army.”

Ben-Hadad said, “Those men might come to our army in order to make peace. If those men come to our army in order to make peace, capture them. And don't kill those men. Or those men might come to our army in order to make war. If those men come to our army in order to make war, capture them. And don't kill those men.”
The young men walked and went from the city. The army was behind those young men.

Each man of Israel killed the soldier who was fighting him. When the soldiers of the army of Aram saw the men of Israel killing them, they ran away from them. Israel's army chased the army of Aram. But Ben-Hadad, who was the king of Aram, escaped from Israel's army on a horse. Some of Ben-Hadad's men who rode horses escaped with him.

But the king of Israel attacked Ben-Hadad's men who rode horses. He defeated the men who rode horses and the men who were in the chariots. The people of the king of Israel hurt very many men of Aram and killed very many men of Aram.

Then the prophet came to the king of Israel again. The prophet said, “Cause your kingdom to be stronger. Do the things that you have to do. When the next year begins, the king of Aram will attack you again.”

During that time the officials of the king of Aram advised the king of Aram. They said, “Israel was stronger than us because its gods are gods of the hills. But if we fight Israel on the plains, we'll certainly be stronger than Israel.
These things are things that you should do. Don't let the 32 kings continue being the leaders of the army. Choose other officers in order to replace the 32 kings.

You have to also gather another army. That army should be strong like the army that Israel defeated was strong. That army should have the same number of horses and the same number of chariots. Then we'll be able to fight Israel on the plains. And we'll certainly be stronger than Israel.” Ben-Hadad agreed with his officials and did the things they advised him.
When the next year began, Ben-Hadad gathered the men of Aram. Those men went up to the city named Aphek in order to fight Israel.

Ahab also gathered Israel's army and gave it the things that it needed. Israel's army marched into the land in order to fight the enemies of Israel. Israel's army camped near the army of Aram. Israel's army looked like two small groups of goats. But the men of Aram covered the land.

God's man came to the king of Israel again. God's man said to the king of Israel, “Yahweh says, “The men of Aram think that Yahweh is a god of the hills. The men of Aram don't think that Yahweh is a god of the valleys. So I'll cause your army to defeat the extremely big army of Aram. Then you and the people of Israel will know that I'm Yahweh.””

For seven days the two armies camped near each other. On the seventh day the battle began. The total number of the soldiers who were killed by Israel's people or were wounded by them was 100000. And this thing happened in one day.
The other men of Aram ran to the city named Aphek. And the wall of that city fell on 27000 of those men. Ben-Hadad ran to the city. He hid in a secret room.

The officials Ben-Hadad said to him, “We have heard that the kings of Israel are kind often. We let's go to the king of Israel. Let's wear the rough clothes that people wear when they are sad. And we let's tie ropes around our heads. Then Ahab might not kill you.”

So the officials wore the rough clothes that people wear when they are sad. They tied ropes around their heads. Then they went to the king of Israel. They said to the king of Israel, “Your servant named Ben-Hadad says, “Please let me live.”” The king answered, “Is Ben-Hadad still alive? Ben-Hadad was my friend.”

The officials thought that that thing was good news. So they used quickly that same thing that Ahab had used. They said, “Yes! Your friend named Ben-Hadad!” The king said, “Go and get Ben-Hadad.” Ben-Hadad came from the secret room. Then Ahab caused Ben-Hadad to come to him in his chariot.

Ben-Hadad said, “I'll return the cities that my father took from your father. You may set markets up yourself in Damascus like my father set markets up in Samaria.” Ahab said, “If you and I make a treaty of peace, I'll release you.” So Ben-Hadad and Ahab made a treaty. Then Ahab lets Ben-Hadad go.

There was a group of people named the group of the prophets. One of those people received a message from Yahweh. He said to his friend, “Please hit me with your weapon.” But that person's friend refused to hit him.
The prophet said, “You don't obey Yahweh. When you leave me, a lion will immediately kill you.” That friend left. And a lion found that friend and killed him.
The prophet found another man. That person said, “Please hit me.” So that man hit that person and hurt him.
Then the prophet went. And that person stood by the road. He waited for the king to pass him. That person put a bandage over his eyes so-that people couldn't recognize him.

The king came to the place where the prophet was. Then that prophet said to the king, “I entered the middle of the battle. A soldier came to me with a prisoner. That soldier said, “Guard this man. Don't let this man escape. If this man escapes, you'll pay for his life your life. Or you may pay 34 kilograms of silver.”
While I was doing other things here and there, the man escaped.” The king of Israel spoke to that person. The king said, “The things that you have said are the things that will happen to you.
Then the prophet took off quickly the bandage that was over that prophet's eyes. The king of Israel recognized that man and knew that he was one of the prophets.

The prophet said to the king, “Yahweh says, “You have released a man. But I told you to completely destroy that man. So you have to pay for that man's life your life. You have to pay for that man's people's lives your people's lives.””
The king of Israel was upset and angry. He returned to his palace in Samaria.
People judge each man about the things he has done the things.
Those people's hearts were joy.
Rehoboam went to the city named Shechem because all of Israel's people had gone to Shechem in order to cause him to become the king.

At that time Jeroboam, who was Nebat's son, still was in Egypt, where he had run away from King Solomon. But when Jeroboam heard that Rehoboam had gone to Shechem in order to become the king, he returned from Egypt.
So the people sent a person in order to call Jeroboam. Then Jeroboam and all of Israel's people went to Rehoboam.
The people said to Rehoboam, “Your father put a heavy load on our shoulders. Now cause our hard work to be easier. If you cause our heavy load to become less heavy, we'll serve you.”
Rehoboam answered, “Leave me for three days. Then return to me.” So the people left.

King Rehoboam asked the elders to advise him. Those elders had served Solomon who was Rehoboam's father while Solomon still was alive. Rehoboam asked those elders, “What do you advise me I do? How should I answer these people?”
The elders answered, “Today serve the people. Give the people the things that they want. Then the people will always serve you.”
But Rehoboam refused to do the things that the elders advised him he did. Instead he asked the young men to advise him. The young men had grown up with Rehoboam and were serving him now.
Rehoboam asked the young men, “What should I do? How should I answer these people? The people say to me, “Cause the load that your father put on our shoulders to be less heavy.””

The young men who had grown up with Rehoboam answered, “These people have said to you, “Your father put a heavy load on our shoulders. Cause our load to be less heavy.” Now say to the people, “My little finger is stronger than my father's legs.
My father put a heavy load on your shoulders. But I'll cause your load to even be heavier. My father beats you whips. But I'll beat you bigger whips.””
Three days later Jeroboam and all of the people returned to Rehoboam. The people returned because the king had said, “Return to me in three days.”
The king answered the people cruelly. He didn't do the things that the elders advised him he'll do.

Instead the king did the things that the young men advised him he'll do. He said, “My father put a heavy load on your shoulders. But I'll cause your load to even be heavier. My father beat you whips. But I'll beat you bigger whips.”

So the king didn't listen to the people because Yahweh had caused these things to happen. And so the things that Yahweh had said through Ahijah happened. Ahijah had told the message of Yahweh to Jeroboam who was Nebat's son. Ahijah was from Shiloh.

All of Israel's people saw that the king refused to listen to them. So they answered the king, “We don't have any part in David's royal family. We don't have any part in Jesse's son. Israel's people, let's return to our homes. David's royal family, care for your nation!” So Israel's people returned to their homes.
But Rehoboam still ruled the people of Israel who were living in the towns Judah.

Adoniram managed those people that the king's soldiers forced to work hard for King Rehoboam. The king sent Adoniram among all of the people of Israel. But the people of Israel threw stones at Adoniram and killed him. King Rehoboam escaped in the chariot him and went to Jerusalem.
Today Israel still refuses to follow David's royal family.

All of the people of Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned. So they sent a person in order to call Jeroboam. They wanted Jeroboam to meet all of them. Then they caused Jeroboam to become the king of the whole nation of Israel. Only the tribe Judah still followed David's royal family.

Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem. He gathered 180000 strong young men who were from Judah or were from the tribe of Benjamin. He had decided to fight Israel. He wanted his soldiers to defeat Israel so-that he could rule its people again.
But Shemaiah received a word from God. Shemaiah was God's man.

God said to Shemaiah, “Speak to the son of Solomon named Rehoboam who is the king of Judah. Speak to all of Judah's people. Speak to all of the people of the tribe of Benjamin. Also speak to all of the other people.”

Say to your people, “Yahweh says, “Don't go in order to fight Israel's people. Israel's people are your relatives. I want all of you to return to your houses. The things that have happened have happened like I wanted them to happen.”” So the soldiers Rehoboam did the things that the message of Yahweh said. They returned to their houses like Yahweh had ordered them to return there.

Jeroboam caused people to build the walls of Shechem so-that the walls of Shechem would be stronger. Shechem was in the hill country of Ephraim. Jeroboam decided to live in Shechem. He went from Shechem to Peniel and caused people to build the walls of Peniel so-that the walls of Peniel would be stronger.
Jeroboam thought, “David's royal family might take my kingdom from me easily. My kingdom still isn't safe.

If Israel's people go up to Jerusalem in order to offer sacrifices at Yahweh's temple, they'll again decide to follow Rehoboam who is the king of Judah. Rehoboam will be the lord Israel's people. Then Israel's people will kill me and follow King Rehoboam again.”

So King Jeroboam asked some people to advise him. Then he made two gold statues that looked like calves. He said to the people, “It is too difficult for you to go up to Jerusalem. Israel, these statues are your gods that brought you from Egypt.”
Jeroboam set one statue up in Bethel. He set the other statue up in Dan.

The things that Jeroboam did were sinful. And the things that Jeroboam did caused Israel to sin. Some people went to Bethel in order to worship the statue that was there. Other people even went far to Dan in order to worship the statue that was there.
Jeroboam built temples on the high places so-that the people could worship gods there. He appointed priests all kinds of people. He even appointed priests people who were not from the tribe of Levi.

Jeroboam made a new feast so-that people could celebrate it each year. The feast was on the fifteenth day of the 8th month. Jeroboam wanted the feast to be like the Feast of Booths that people celebrated in Judah. He built the altar at Bethel. He offered sacrifices on the altar. He sacrificed offerings to the calves that he had made. He also put priests in Bethel and put them at the high places that he had made.

Jeroboam offered sacrifices on the altar that he had built at Bethel. He offered the sacrifices on the fifteenth day of the 8th month. That month is the month that Jeroboam had chosen. So Jeroboam made the feast for the people of Israel and went to the altar in order to sacrifice offerings.
A sweet substance that insects that fly make.
Primary: You have turned me. Alternate 1: You have left me.
You're able to know that these things are true like you know that Yahweh, who is your God, is alive.
Then Jeroboam's wife started going.
These things were the things that Yahweh had said that will happen.
The throne had sides that the king rested his arms at.
Rehoboam who was Solomon's son wanted his soldiers to defeat Israel so-that he could rule its people again
The people Judah did things that caused Yahweh to be angry more than all of the people who previously lived.
People cut bull into pieces.
And Ahab gave Israel's army the things that it needed.
Elijah repaired Yahweh's altar that people had destroyed.
Let's wear the rough clothes that people wear when they are sad. Let's tie ropes around our heads. Let's tie ropes around our heads.
The people who stay in each place have to bring gifts for those people who are going.
At that time Abijah became sick. He was Jeroboam's son.

Jeroboam said to his wife, “Go. Put different clothes on. Then people won't know that you're my wife. Go to Shiloh, where Ahijah, who is a prophet, is. Ahiajh told me that I'll be the king of the people Israel.
Take ten loaves of bread. Take some pieces of flat bread and a jar of the sweet substance that insects that fly make. Go to Ahijah. Ahijah will tell you the things that will happen to our son.”
So Jeroboam's wife did the things that he said. She went to Ahijah's house that was in Shiloh. Ahijah was not able to see. He was not able to see because he was very old.

But Yahweh had said to Ahijah, “Jeroboam's wife is coming. Jeroboam's wife's son is sick. Jeroboam's wife will ask you about her son. Tell Jeroboam's wife the answer that I'll give to you. When Jeroboam's wife arrives, she'll pretend to be a different person.”

When Jeroboam's wife was at the door, Ahijah heard the sound of her steps. He said, “Enter my house. I know that you're Jeroboam's wife. Why do you pretend to be a different person? I have bad news for you.
Go. Tell Jeroboam that Yahweh has a message for Jeroboam. Yahweh is God Israel. Yahweh says, “I chose you from all of the people. I chose you so-that you would be the king of my people named Israel.

I tore the nation David's royal family. I gave the nation to you. But you haven't been like my servant named David. David obeyed my commands. Primary: He followed me all of his heart. Alternate 1: David completely followed me. End of Alternates. David did only things that I said that were good.

You have done more evil things than all of those people who previously lived. You have made other gods for yourself. You have made objects gods from metal. You have caused me to be very angry. Primary: You have turned me. Alternate 1: You have abandoned me.
After it didn't rain for three years, Yahweh spoke to Elijah. Yahweh said, “Go. Talk to Ahab. Then I'll cause it to rain.”
So Elijah went in order to talk to Ahab. There was not enough food in Samaria. The people who were in Samaria were very hungry.
Ahab sent Obadiah. Obadiah managed the palace. He respected Yahweh a lot.
The wife of Ahab named Jezebel was killing Yahweh's prophets. So Obadiah had hidden one hundred prophets in two caves. He had hidden fifty prophets in each cave and had given food and water to them.

Ahab said to Obadiah, “Go through the land. Go to all of the valleys and all of the springs water. Perhaps we'll find some grass there. If the horses and mules eat the grass, they won't die. Then we won't need to kill any of our animals.”
So Ahab and Obadiah decided the regions where they'll search for grass. Ahab went to one region. And Obadiah went to another region.
While Obadiah was walking, Elijah met him. Obadiah recognized Elijah and bowed to him. Obadiah said, “My master, Elijah, are you truly Elijah?”
Elijah answered, “Yes.” Then Elijah said, “Go and say to Ahab who is your master, “Elijah is here.””
Obadiah asked, “What I have done wrong? Why do you send me to Ahab so-that he could kill me?

My master has sent to each place people who are searching for you. There isn't a nation that Ahab hasn't sent people to in order to find you. If a nation were to say that you were in it, Ahab would cause the leaders of it to say to him it was not able to find you. You're able to know that these things are true like you know that Yahweh, who is your God, is alive.
But now you're telling me to go to my master. You want me to say, “Elijah is here.”

But when I leave you, the Spirit of Yahweh might take you to a place that I don't know about. If I go to Ahab, and if I tell him that I have found you, and if he doesn't find you, he'll kill me. But I have served Yahweh since the time when I was young.

Adonijah was the son of David and of Haggith, who was one of his wives. Adonijah decided to act. And he said, “I'll be the next king.” So Adonijah gathered chariots and men who rode horses.
